steps: Rinse barley and soak 15 minutes if possible to reduce cooking time.
Sauté chopped onion (and carrot if used) in olive oil/butter until soft.
Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute to remove raw taste.
Add barley and stock/water, bring to a gentle boil.
Cook 20–25 minutes until barley is tender.
Add vermicelli and cook 5–7 minutes more.
Season with salt and pepper, rest 3 minutes, serve hot.
Boil chicken with onion and carrot until cooked (about 25–30 minutes).
Remove chicken, shred the meat, discard bones/skin.
Strain broth if you want a clearer soup.
Return broth to pot, add shredded chicken and simmer 10 minutes.
Adjust salt/pepper; add lemon juice for a brighter taste.
Serve hot.
Sauté onion in oil/butter until soft.
Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute.
Add diced vegetables and stir 2 minutes.
Pour in stock/water and bring to a boil.
Simmer 20–25 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Season and optionally finish with dried mint.
Sauté onion and sliced mushrooms in butter until mushrooms release water and brown slightly.
Add flour and cook 1 minute (roux).
Slowly add milk while whisking to avoid lumps.
Add stock/water and simmer 10–15 minutes.
Blend partially if you want a creamier texture.
Season with salt and pepper, serve.
Cook rice in water until nearly soft (10–12 minutes).
In a bowl, whisk yogurt with egg (optional) and a spoon of flour (optional) until smooth.
Temper: add a few ladles of hot soup into the yogurt mixture while whisking.
Pour mixture back into the pot on low heat, stirring constantly (do not boil hard).
Simmer 5–7 minutes until slightly thickened.
Finish with butter and dried mint, season and serve.
Pound chicken breast to even thickness.
Season with salt and pepper.
Coat in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs.
Heat oil in a pan (medium heat).
Fry 3–4 minutes per side until golden and cooked through.
Rest 2 minutes on paper towel, serve.
Season steak with salt and pepper.
Sear on a hot pan 2–4 minutes each side (depending on thickness).
Rest steak 5 minutes.
In the same pan sauté mushrooms and onion with butter/oil.
Add garlic; optionally add a splash of cream for sauce.
Serve mushrooms over steak.
